Re: License #: CB820315857
Investigation #: 2023C0000208
Dear Darnell Britt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

Detroit, MI 48205-2748

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pushed youth into a wall.
Investigation On 1/30/2023 Complainant reported allegation to DCWL.
Complainant stated Youth A reported an incident that occurred on
1/23/2023 with Staff 1 at the Independent Living (IL) house. Youth
A reported to Complainant that he lit incense in the bedroom at
the IL house. Staff 1 then entered the bedroom and began tearing
apart Youth A’s belongings, looking for drug paraphernalia. Staff
1 threw Youth A’s clothes on the floor and moved the bed off of
the bed frame. Youth A was upset and told the staff to stop. Staff
1 then “turned and threw him (Youth A) through the drywall”. Staff
1 then turned and threw Youth A into the other wall, breaking the
drywall twice. Staff 1 reportedly said to another, unknown staff, “I
don’t search rooms like you, I search them like the police”. Youth
A stated that Staff 1 was upset with him about an incident that
occurred the day prior, with another staff (Staff 2). The prior
incident was investigated by DCWL, 2023C0000210.
Youth A was interviewed in person by MDHHS courtesy worker on
1/31/2023, as Youth A moved out of the area prior to the
allegation being reported. Youth A is a Juvenile Justice, non-foster
care youth, currently living in in an unknown hotel with his mother.
Per the interview notes provided by the MDHHS courtesy worker,
a face-to-face interview was completed with Youth A on 1/31/2023
at a relative’s home. Youth A reported feeling unsafe while at the
facility. Youth A reported youth at the IL house smoked cigarettes
and marijuana. Youth A denied observing this behavior from staff.
Youth A recalled the night of the incident on 1/23/2023 and stated
Youth B and Staff 1 were present at the house. Youth A reported
he lit incense in his room before Staff 1 came in and started
tearing up his room, searching for drug paraphernalia. Youth A
told Staff 1 to stop searching and tearing up his room. Staff 1
responded “what are you going to do about it?” Staff 1 then
pushed Youth A. Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A and threw him
through the wall, causing two holes in the bedroom wall. Staff 1
grabbed Youth A again and threw him through another wall. Youth
A reported he grabbed Staff 1 and held him, to prevent the staff
from pushing him again. Staff 1 then went downstairs. Youth A
went downstairs to the bathroom with a knife and shut the door.
The police then knocked on the bathroom door and Youth A
2

responded that he was suicidal. Youth A denied observing any
staff physically discipline any other youth. Youth A admitted he
had a history of physical violence with adults and authority figures.
Youth A was concerned about being escalated to a secure facility
by his Probation Officer.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/7/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported he arrived at
the house on 1/23/23 and smelled incense burning. Youth are not
allowed to burn incense or smoke in the house. Staff 1 knew the
incense was likely an attempt to cover up cigarette or marijuana
smoke. Staff 1 went upstairs to Youth A’s room and found Youth A
and Youth B standing in the doorway, as if they were trying to hide
something. Staff 1 entered the bedroom, saw the incense, and
told both youth they cannot burn incense in the house. Youth B
went downstairs to his bedroom. Staff 1 informed Youth A he was
going to search his room, as Youth A had been caught smoking
marijuana in the house recently. Staff 1 began looking through
Youth A's dresser drawers. Youth A asked why he was doing that.
Staff 1 again explained he was searching the room for drugs. Staff
1 opened a drawer full of x-box games and Youth A grabbed his
arm. Staff 1 instructed Youth A to let go. Staff 1 then flipped his
arm around to shake Youth A’s hands off of him. Staff 1 continued
searching, while Youth A repeatedly yelled and swore at Staff 1,
asking why he was searching the room. Staff 1 looked under the
bed and in the closet. Youth A was belligerent, loud, and calling
staff names. Staff 1 stated he remained calm and continued
searching. Staff 1 denied throwing anything or destroying any
belongings. Staff 1 denied ever stating he searched like the police.
Staff 1 reported there were no other staff present for him to say
that too, as was indicated in the allegations. Staff 1 did not locate
any drugs or paraphernalia and exited the bedroom. While in the
hallway, Youth A charged at Staff 1, shoving him into the wall at
the top of the steps, next to a window. Staff 1 reported he narrowly
missed hitting the window and hit the drywall, causing a large hole
in the wall with his body. Staff 1 stated Youth A continued pushing
on him, possibly attempting to push him down the stairs. Staff 1
used the wall to steady himself and lean away from the stairs.
Staff 1 attempted to stand up and gain his balance, which caused
he and Youth A to stumble into the adjoining wall. Staff 1 reported
there were two small holes in the second wall, although he was
unsure if they were from him or Youth A.
After Staff 1 stood up, he walked downstairs and Youth A went to
his room. Staff 1 could hear Youth A pacing the floor, banging on
something, and talking on his phone. Staff 1 did not know what the
banging noise was but did not want to go back upstairs and further
agitate Youth A. Youth A then went downstairs into the kitchen,
3

then into the front closet, and into the bathroom where he shut the
door. Staff 1 found this concerning and asked Youth A what he
was doing. Youth A refused to answer. Staff 1 could hear banging
noises in the bathroom and attempted to talk with Youth A through
the door. But Youth A would not respond. Staff 1 then pushed the
door open and found Youth A with a paint can and a kitchen knife.
Youth A was also holding a bottle of unknown yellow cleaning
liquid, with several unknown pills in it. Youth A put the bottle to his
mouth, but Staff 1 pulled it away. The police then entered the
house and intervened with Youth A, removing him from the house.
Staff 1 stated he did not call the police, so he was unsure why
they arrived when they did.
The walls and bathroom door were observed and found to have
already been repaired.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/7/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported being at the
house during the incident on 2/23/23 with Youth A and Staff 1.
However, Youth B stated he was not upstairs during the
altercation. Youth B was initially upstairs by Youth A’s bedroom
when Staff 1 first came to the house. Youth A was smoking
marijuana and tobacco in his room. When Staff 1 arrived at the
house and went upstairs he asked both youth if they had
marijuana. Youth A denied smoking anything but had a lighter in
his hand, which caused Staff 1 to be suspicious. Youth B denied
having anything, then went downstairs to his room. Youth B heard
Staff 1 state he was going to search the room. Youth A began
yelling, with angry outbursts. Youth B described it as sounding like
a little kid throwing a tantrum. Youth B heard some banging
sounds upstairs but did not see any of the physical interaction
between Youth A and Staff 1. A few minutes later, Staff 1 went
back downstairs to the living room and sat on the couch. Youth B
could hear Youth A walking around upstairs, calling people on his
phone. Youth A then went downstairs with a backpack, walked
around a little, then went into the bathroom. Youth B heard Staff 1
ask Youth A what he was doing. But Youth A refused to answer
and shut the bathroom door. Staff 1 then pushed the bathroom
door open and found Youth A with a sharp kitchen knife and some
other things. The police then arrived at the house and took over
from there. Youth B stated the police were sent to the house by
his girlfriend. His girlfriend was not at the house but had been
trying to call him. When Youth B had not returned her calls, the
girlfriend called the police to do a welfare check, as she was
concerned about him. Overall Youth B reported he did not have
any concerns with staff and described Staff 1 as “super laid-back”.
4

On 2/22/23 a conference call occurred with DHHS, in which it was
reported there were no findings for this investigation.
Analysis There was no information found to support a rule violation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
________________February 27, 2023_____________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
